entry.div:
Painting in
distemper
on
wood
Because it is very tedious to paint in
distemper
on
wood
, and because one is at pains to make a good
a
face on it, some thin their colors with
glair of egg
passed through a
sponge
, or mixed with the
yolk
,
water
, & thoroughly beaten with the
peelings of the
fig tree
. With this
|
they paint & soften on the
wood
, as with
oil
, and this supports the
varnish
, but this does not last.
